Reviews.Content: what a dump First of all this pension is at 5th floor and there`s no elevator.Rooms are very small and the bathrooms are a dump.Even if it is said the breakfast is included do not expect more than a coffe or tea.The lady who welcomes guests does not know more than catalan so there is a problem trying to communicate something.The location is good ,I had a view on Rambla but much to noisy.Don`t stay here
Reviews.Author: katacomba

Reviews.Content: dont stay here dont stay here or sister hostel the piccaso, it will spoil your barcelona experience.infact dont stay on las ramblas if you ask me.i booked on line over a month in advance but was told no room. you dont need this after a tiring flight.Eventually given another room in different building took me an extra hour to find it carrying luggage etc.room was like a prison cell. very noisey, no sleepno beakfast as advertisedAfrican prostitutes hasling me on my home at night outsidela ramblas is not good value. bar prices inflated and food poor quality. why not get a proper hotel in nicer district. it will be better value in the long run. All the attractions are away from las ramblas anyway.the photos of this place are enhanced for sure.
Reviews.Author: awiseguy

Reviews.Content: Great Location I stayed here at the beginning of this month, and I have to say all we made out on was location! Its a great location in the middle of everything, but there were cockroaches in the room *yuck*! we only saw them once when returning from being out and no the door was not left open to the outside. you have to be in shape to get up those 5 flight of stairs and its better to have a pack up those stairs instead of dragging luggage up the stairs!!!! We saw some people who didn't look like they were going to make it up a couple of times. the room is tiny good for one maybe but not for three, unless you only care about a shelter and shower and NOTHING ELSE. GREAT PLACE FOR YOUNG BACKPACKERS BUT NOT REALLY ANY OTHER KIND OF TRAVELER.
Reviews.Author: AmyURangel

Reviews.Content: Small, unclean and just gross! This hostel is one of the worst hostels I have stayed at...it's not only 5 flights of stairs up to the damn place, but once you get there, you're greated by a very unwelcoming lady who hands you a set of keys and doesn't even bother you to show you where your room is. The room itself (422) was so small....cramped and dirty.....gross! The bathroom was filthy, tiles hanging everywhere...it was overpriced and I will certainly not stay there again! Stay away from this hostel!
Reviews.Author: Ottawachica

Reviews.Content: Stay away - Barcelona hellhole The big heavy door at the entrance to this place is almost impossible to get open and maybe that's a hint that you shouldn't enter!It's about 5 flights of stairs to the pension via a smelly, graffiti covered stairwell. The lady on the desk spoke very little English and looked like she had never made the trek up or down the stairs herself (despite smelling like she had been running up and down them all day).The pension had a hospital like smell that tends to come from the use of industrial strength cleaning products but, on checking into our room, we were unsure of where this smell was coming from as it looked like there had not been any cleaning products used in the room for a long time.The 'double bed' was not much bigger than a single and it only came with one long (and very flat) pillow that was supposed be used by 2 people. The room was tiny and one person had to move to the other side of the room to enable us to even open the bathroom door.Our window looked into a grotty internal air well so we didn't get any noise from the street noise but we were fairly close to the reception area and were kept awake all night with guests buzzing to be let in (as the door to the pension is locked) and chatting loudly (and drunkenly) to the person on the reception desk.The 'breakfast' room consisted of 3 tiny tables in a hallway onto which the communal bathrooms opened. People walking in and out of the bathrooms had to squeeze past our table and we were occasionally hit with the bathroom steam when people opened the doors after their showers. Breakfast consisted of two types of unidentifiable cereal and some white liquid which was a rough approximation of milk. We dared to ask for toast but gave up on it after waiting for 20 minutes to no avail.The only redeeming factor about this place is its excellent location right on La Rambla.All in all, this place may be tempting as it is cheap but don't go near this place if you know what's good for you.
Reviews.Author: LondonMel

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for Well what can you expect for the price you pay - this place is no Hilton BUT once you get past the grafitti in the foyer, the half naked men hanging out of the windows doing handyman work with live electrical wires hanging from the ceiling perilously close to puddles and up the hundred odd stairs the place is quite charming!The receptionist welcomed us (my friend from uni and I in our early 20s backpacking aroung Europe) in and let us rest in the breakfast room/lobby even though we arrived a couple of hours before our check-in time. Our room was clean with two single beds, a tv, a basin, a shower cubicle and best of all a balcony that overlooked La Ramblas! It was a delight to sit out there in the early evening after arriving home from a hectic day of shopping and site-seeing to recharge before heading out for dinner and a dance. My favourite time was about 7pm when all the street performers were out putting on shows right outside. I think we were lucky enough to get the best room in the place so if you can ask for a room with a window on to La Ramblas. Breakfast was also lovely - tea, coffee, hot chocolate, crossaints etc It was huge so most days my friend and I didn't need lunch.  All in all Pension Bahia is in an excellent location with neat rooms and great value.
Reviews.Author: amok

Reviews.Content: very very charming ok, bahia is the cheapest, so what do you want? the hostal is absolutely save, to say you can get raped in here is absolutely unbelieve and ridiculous. very nice staff, all rooms clean, some bigger, some smaller, some with bathroom some without. And loud? this is barcelona! this is the centre of barcelona! you are in spain, in europas youngest and freshest city and not in rocky mountains, you know. smell of urine, problems with graffity? Graffity either, I mean this hostal is for young people! the lady sitting behind the desk is a really catalunya original and very nice, and if she lay down at night to wait for you to come? what麓s wrong with that?go to bahia. 40 鈧?including nice breakfast, cheaper and more central and more charming is really not possible. Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Oh, No. This is a tiny little door off las Ramblas. We were required to pay, in cash, for the whole stay before we got to our room. That should have clued us in- the room was tiny, and faced a extremely loud discotheque across the street. we will not be staying there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good leg muscles! Arrived in Barcelona in sweltering 37 degrees, to find we had to climb 4 flights of stairs with our backpacks (92 steps to be precise, yes, we counted!!) to reach reception.Staff extremely friendly, although english not so good! Allocated a double room , towards the back of the building that was tiny and boiling! Our window backed onto a closed courtyard, resulting in no air flow!! Using broken spanish and sign language managed to get a room change that brought us closer to the action off the La Ramblas. This room was extremely noisy with sounds of party goers until 3am and then at about 7am trucks started cleaning the streets. However, we could not sleep anyway due to the extreme heat in the room!Breakfast is included and was quite enjoyable. This hostel is cheap and right in the heart of Barcelona, so if you are keen to stay out late and don麓t mind the heat and stairs, it is in an ideal location!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent Location and Value for Money This hostel is right on Las Ramblas 30 secs from Placa Catalunya. Location was just perfect. I was pleasantly surprised by the room: large double room with balcony, tv, sink. Hostel was very clean and staff were lovely altho had no English. Sheets were changed every day and clean towels left in your room. You could have fresh croissants or toast and coffee for breakfast. Location was so good couldnt really fault the hostel although my ?75 underwear was taken from the room (it was on the bed) but i dont know was this a mistake when changing sheets or theft so my advice would be to put your stuff away in the room. Overall excellent!
Reviews.Author: ZittaN

Reviews.Content: cheap n' convenient this place is right off the ramblas. smack dab in the middle of everything, or at least right by the placa catalunya that can transport you anywhere you want to go. ok, i never woke up for the breakfast. ok, it is up 4 tiring flights of stairs. ok, i speak no spanish, they, no english. ok, it isn't austere, sterile, hospital clean. but all in all, it was **** cheap, they were sweet and when i did finally wake up. i was right in the thick of barcelona action.
